page.title: 11Kettlesing - Bus v. Car
page.content: Like most rural areas, the block suffers from a diminishing public transport system. The West Yorkshire Road Car Company provides Kettlesing village and Men- with Hill with an average of two buses daily to Harrogate, and a connection to Otley on Saturdays. High Birstwith has no bus service, the nearest being at Birstwith village. Menwith Hill Station has its own regular private bus service to Harrogate, for all station personnel. Car transport is, therefore, virtu- ally indispensable, and there is a growing problem of social and physical isolation for many groups of society, i.e., the old, young mothers and teenagers.
